title: 70's album font
content:
Hi all,

Can anyone identify the ampersand used in this? I believe the other font is Avant Garde, but I'd love to know the closest version...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421184219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/4293645030_0739bd9861_6726.jpg)

Font: 

 L&C Hairline 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421184219/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [4293645030\_0739bd9861.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421184219/http:/typophile.com/files/4293645030_0739bd9861.jpg) | 137.19 KB |
author: Fiver

comments.content: Should be [L&C Hairline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421184219/http:/e-daylight.jp/design/fonts/type/l/lc-hairline.html) by Lubalin & Carnase and revived under the name of [Silver Thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421184219/http:/marketplace.veer.com/type/JBT0000108) and [Receding Hairline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421184219/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/receding-hairline-nf).
